identificationModule.officialTitle: Futuros Fuertes 2.0 A Primary Care Based Intervention to Prevent Obesity Among Low-income Latino Children

collaborators.name: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The goal of this study is to evaluate the impact of a primary care based intervention to promote optimal feeding, screen time and sleep practices among low-income Latino infants and toddlers. Infants and caregivers will receive brief health education and coaching sessions from health educators at primary care visits in the first two years of life as well as two text messages per week with health information and tips. Half of the participants will receive the Futuros Fuertes 2.0 intervention that includes health coaching and education on infant feeding, screen time and sleep (intervention group). The other half will receive health coaching and education on safety, home management of childhood illnesses, and promotion of language development (control group). We will look at the impact of the Futuros Fuertes 2.0 intervention on child BMI and various health behaviors.

armGroups.label: Intervention
armGroups.description: The Futuros Fuertes 2.0 intervention includes brief health education and coaching at well child visits in the first two years of life that addresses optimal feeding, screen time and sleep practices. In addition, caregivers receive 2 text messages per week. Caregivers also receive environmental prompts to help support healthy behaviors at home.

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: The control intervention includes brief health education and coaching at well child visits in the first two years of life that addresses home safety, management of common childhood illnesses, and promotion of language development. In addition, caregivers receive 2 text messages per week. Caregivers also receive environmental prompts to help support healthy behaviors at home.

interventions.name: Control
interventions.description: The control intervention includes brief health education and coaching sessions just after well child visits in the first two years of life (total of 7 sessions), 2 text messages per week for the primary caregiver and up to two additional family members, and environmental prompts that support healthy behaviors. The control intervention focuses on home safety, home management of common childhood illnesses, and promotion of language development.

interventions.name: Futuros Fuertes 2.0
interventions.description: The Futuros Fuertes 2.0 intervention includes brief health education and coaching sessions just after well child visits in the first two years of life (total of 7 sessions), 2 text messages per week for the primary caregiver and up to two additional family members, and environmental prompts that support healthy behaviors. The Futuros Fuertes 2.0 intervention focuses on optimal infant feeding, screen time, and sleep practices.

primaryOutcomes.description: BMI Z-score based on WHO growth curves

secondaryOutcomes.description: Duration of breastfeeding in first year of life

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sugar sweetened beverage and 100% fruit juice intake
secondaryOutcomes.description: Daily ounces of sugar-sweetened beverages and 100% fruit juice
Trajectory of BMI Z-score (WHO growth curve)

otherOutcomes.description: Daily ounces of sugar-sweetened beverages and 100% fruit juice

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Parent/caregiver self identifies as Latino
* Parent/caregiver speaks Spanish or English
* Parent/caregiver intends to receive primary care for infant at participating clinic
* Infant gestational age of 37 weeks or greater
* Infant birthweight of 2600 grams or greater
* For multiples (twins, triplets), one sibling will be chosen at random to participate

Exclusion Criteria:

-Infant has a serious medical condition that affects feeding or growth

locations.facility: Children's Health Center San Francisco General Hospital

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: After completion of the study, final research data will be available for use by other investigators, federal agencies, or other appropriate organizations or personnel upon request. Research data will be shared in a de-identified data set to protect subject privacy.
